results.title: Open classroom
results.brief_description: This film explores some of the issues involved in the organisation of the open classroom, and focuses on ordinary non-purpose built schools in both Britain and USA. It emphasises the need for an underlying structure and a high level of involvement and co-ordination by teachers and other personnel. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.
results.description: This film explores some of the issues involved in the organisation of the open classroom, and focuses on ordinary non-purpose built schools in both Britain and USA. results.title: Ya Vamos. No. 1. A Mexico
results.creator_credit: Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Joshua Tree Productions
results.brief_description: A Spanish language film. Provides some cultural background of Mexico to students learning elementary Spanish with the text “entender y hablar”. Shows Lucia Sznchez and Sara Lopez travelling throughout Mexico.

results.title: Using equivalent fractions to compute sums
results.brief_description: Fraction County, so named because of the Fraction surnames given to each family, found it had families that could not live together happily. The problem was solved when the families realized they had something in common: equivalent fractions get along together. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Between rational numbers
results.brief_description: taches the concept of an infinite set of numbers, using the story of a tricky old king who promises his kingdom to any of the knights who can tell him the next rational number after one third.

results.title: Measure volume: think metric
results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of measuring volume in metric units. Shows young people as they measure the volume of things in their home.

results.title: Measure length
results.brief_description: Two boys who explore their neighbourhood with a metre stick and a centimetre rule discover the comparative size of things around them. Explains the importance of measuring length and defines the standard metric unit.

results.title: Johnny can learn to read
results.creator_credit: Courtney Milne, Audio Visual Services and University of Guelph
results.brief_description: Shows the Stott Programmed Reading Kit in use with children who have reading difficulties. The processes of learning to read are broken down into easy stages and each stage is built into a game or some other enjoyable activity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Courtney Milne, Audio Visual Services and University of Guelph

results.title: Gas welding
results.brief_description: This film introduces gas welding step by step. The nine sections of the film deal with all stages of welding. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Modern elementary mathematics: equations
results.brief_description: Animation and simple narration are used to explain the concept of equations. Examples are given to help children understand and correctly use equations to express the equality between numbers. Concludes with a number of true and false number sentences. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
